remarks.format:
## Remarks The default handling behavior for XML markup compatibility in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader> is that the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>, as provided for initialization, is wrapped in a created internal helper class. This helper class reads the markup compatibility nodes separately and enters into the nodes based on markup compatibility of the schema context.
Suggested scenarios for setting <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings.SkipXmlCompatibilityProcessing%2A> to `true` are:
- You want to keep any markup compatibility content in the primary XAML stream.
- You have already processed the markup compatibility because you are using a reader that can process markup compatibility content inline.
- You choose to ignore XML compatibility conventions in your XAML reader implementation for reasons of performance.
